Docs.summary: Entity type extension methods for Sqlite-specific metadata.
Docs.remarks: See Modeling entity types and relationships, and Accessing Sqlite databases with EF Core for more information and examples.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsSqlReturningClauseUsed (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IReadOnlyEntityType entityType);
.method public static hidebysig bool IsSqlReturningClauseUsed(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IReadOnlyEntityType entityType) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function IsSqlReturningClauseUsed (entityType As IReadOnlyEntityType) As Boolean
static member IsSqlReturningClauseUsed : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IReadOnlyEntityType -> bool

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether to use the SQL RETURNING clause when saving changes to the table. The RETURNING clause is incompatible with certain Sqlite features, such as virtual tables or tables with AFTER triggers.
Docs.returns: if the SQL RETURNING clause is used to save changes to the table.
